Technical Details

Programming Philosophy

One makes several design decisions when architecting a new application. Factors to consider are application performance (speed), how long it will take to deliver, ease of future maintenance, etc.

For this particular project I wanted to use common tools and keep the code simple because this framework will definitely be used again, and potentially a different programmmer will have to read and understand the code.

I am a big proponent of keeping things as simple as possible for the reasons listed above. That is why I chose npm over Grunt or Gulp. It is also why I feel ES6 syntax is better than CoffesScript or TypeScript.

Side note: The 17 rules of Unix make a lot of sense to me and I strive to achieve that same level in my programs.

Overview

PHP, Javascript, and MySQL are the primary technologies used in this eLearning framework. PHP Classes and MySQL handle the Models. Javascript handles the navigation, interactions, and Views/Controller.

PHP and MySQL

The PHP code is all object-oriented.

The database uses referential integrity to ensure that the data will be as clean as possible.

ES6/Javascript

The Javascript was written in EcmaScript 2015 (ES6) and transpiled to ES5 via Babel.

SASS/CSS

The CSS was written in SASS syntax that was compiled to CSS using the SASS CLI.
